results.title: African music: old and new
results.brief_description: An introduction to traditional African musical instruments such as flutes, rattles, drums and the Mbira. A modern concert is seen, which shows two African musicians using the traditional instruments with modern ones. These include amplified African drums, electric guitar, a wired Mbira and flutes.

results.title: African girl - Malobi
results.creator_credit: J. Michael Hagopian and Atlantis Productions
results.brief_description: The activities of a ten year old West African girl who sells her grandfather’s carvings in the market place so that she can go to school. Shows how the West African procures shelter, food and clothing, recreation and education.

results.title: Africacult
results.creator_credit: Philip Gaunt, Sam Kofi Bryan, Ghana Film Industry Corporation and Unesco
results.brief_description: The traditional culture of the Ashantis of Ghana goes back hundreds of years but is still very much alive. A “durbar” called by the Ashanti king brings the whole people together for the first time in twenty-two years and shows that cultural identity can be a powerful force for unity in this country.

results.title: Africa: the land and its people. No. 1
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Johannesburg Art Gallery, home of many works of the seventeenth century Dutch and Flemish schools, the French impressionists and the work of many African artists. Work of the South African Institute for Medical Research in the preparation of snake-bite antidotes manufactured from venom extracted from snakes.

results.title: Men like me
results.brief_description: “Men like me” is a collaboration between the filmmaker and Dale Michaels and was made in 1994 when female to male transgender was relatively unfamiliar to the broader community and rarely discussed. Informative and sensitively presented the film uses interviews, vox pops, archival footage and stills, combined with computer animated images and narration by Susan Long and Dale Michaels.

results.title: Kombi Karma
results.brief_description: Kombi Karma examines a cultural icon through the eyes of a diverse group of VW Kombi van lovers. Rachael travels the Victorian countryside in her Kombi and describes her camping trips as ‘more comfortable than being at home’. David, a Kombi enthusiast for over 30 years, is fascinated by the van’s early beginnings as an economical utilities vehicle in occupied Germany during World War II. Some tell of their love of the Kombi’s idiosyncratic design, ‘I love the box shape because it’s such a practical thing to put things in’. Andrew lovingly restores Kombis and believes ‘once you’re bitten by it, it never really goes away, once you own one you really wouldn’t want to own any other sort of car’. And Jan has learned to love Kombis again after her former partner smashed her newly restored Kombi to pieces with a wood splitter. But perhaps Ben sums it up best when he explains that being a Kombi devotee means that ‘you are someone who enjoys the journey as much as the destination’.

results.title: Africa: the land and its people. No. 6
results.brief_description: Magazine items: A survey of the work done to combat plagues in Africa. Shows workers carrying out research in institutions set up to investigate ways and means of destroying the menace; field research; methods of control and destruction at present being practised on the land. The second part of the film deals with Africa’s timber industry, showing the felling of trees; transporting of logs to sawmills; and the uses of timber in homes and industry.

results.title: Africa: the land and its people. No. 5
results.brief_description: Magazine items: The malarial mosquito, the common house fly and the codlin moth are three of the insect pests of the Union. Pyrethrum flowers, grown in Kenya, are processed into insecticides effective is the destruction of all such pests. Second part of the film shows the art of Erma Stern, in particular the artist’s skill in capturing on canvas the many types of people of diversified origin who compose South Africa’s population.

results.title: Africa: the land and its people. No. 4
results.brief_description: Magazine items: Study of Cape Town, seaport and commercial centre of the Union of South Africa. Discusses and illustrates influence of the Dutch on the life and art of the Cape; shows coastal landmarks and suburbs, Table Mountain, the Twelve Apostles; concludes with scenes from a ballet produced by the Corps de Ballet of the University of Cape Town.
